name: St. Benedict Joseph Labre

locations.description: Homeless pilgrim, known as the 'Beggar of Rome'

summary: Benedict Joseph Labre was a French mendicant and pilgrim who became known as the 'Beggar of Rome' and the 'Saint of the Forty Hours.' After failing to join several religious orders due to poor health, he became a wandering pilgrim, traveling to major shrines throughout Europe. He spent the last years of his life in Rome, living in poverty and dedicating himself to prayer and adoration of the Blessed Sacrament.
